page.title: 10Local History_E.K._Change
page.content: East Kilbride was once a small, quiet village with a low population.It was mainly fields with a few farms around.After World War II there was a population boom and new houses were needed.East Kilbride was the chosen site.Many houses and roads were built, also shopping centres,schools,swimming pool and dance halls.The villagers were not pleased as it was not as nice but they were getting new shops better bus and train services and better paid jobs.The schooling then was different. You sat an exam in primary seven.The results determined whether you went to the junior or senior secondary school. The junior school was for people who expected to do a trade ,the senior secondary school for people expected to go to university. Today you dont sit an exam to decide for you,but go straight to secondary school.
